Auber and Scribeâ€™s opera was based on the assassination of King Gustavus III of Sweden (1746â€“92) during a masked ball at the Royal Swedish Opera house. For the October 2014 production by San Francisco Opera, Mexican tenor RamÃ³n Vargas (b. 1960) played Gustavus III, King of Sweden. Adler Fellowship Program graduate Julianna Di Giacomo (b. 1975) made her San Francisco Opera debut as Amelia AnckarstrÃ¶m, a character that Verdi created as the third point in a fictional, ill-fated relationship between King Gustavus III and Swedish military officer Jacob Johan AnckarstrÃ¶m (1762â€“92). The extravagant costumes in the 2014 rendition of ğ˜‰ğ˜¢ğ˜­ğ˜­ğ˜°, including the opulent gown worn by Di Giacomo were originally designed by American designer John Conklin (b. 1937) for a San Francisco Opera production in 1977.   Learn more about San Francisco Operaâ€™s history in our exhibition â€œSan Francisco Opera: A Centennial Celebrationâ€ on display, post-security, in Harvey Milk Terminal 1 and online at: https://bit.ly/SFOperaCentennial
